intro: [WRONG START] Olia delphinensis, commonly known as the Delphinium olisianum, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its tall, spindly stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the flowers are borne in racemes, adding to its ornamental appeal. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
